title.rendered: Badrinath Puja Rates – Online Pooja Booking

content.rendered:
Badrinath visit does not mean just going to the temple of Badri Vishal and taking blessings from the lord. Being a highly pious place of worship with unmatched, pure spiritual energy encapsulating the place, many devotees make it a point to perform various puja services during their visit to Badrinath Dham for Char Dham Yatra.

There are different types of Puja performances that the temple offers that range from a couple of days to years, depending on the type of puja you wish to do. There are online and offline puja options also available that don’t require the presence of the devotee. There are many puja paaths and Abhishek Puja rituals that the temple offers for the pilgrims.

All the proceeds collected through these puja rituals, online or offline, are given to the state government and the temple committee which then goes on for the welfare of the pilgrims.

Here is everything you need to know about the Badrinath puja rates:

Name of Puja Timing Rate in INR
Abhishek Puja (Bandhan) For 10 years 44,201/-
Akhand Jyoti Annual As Per Norms 4,951/-
Astotari Path (Bandhan) For 10 years 4,031/-
Atka Prasad by the Ordinary Mail For 10 years 421/-
Atka Prasad under Regd. Post For 10 years 980/-
Bal Bhog (Bandhan) For 10 years 7,301/-
Bhagwan Nar-Narayan Janmotsav In Shravan Month 4,951/-
Chandi Aarti (Bandhan) For 10 years 2,731/-
Deep Malika Utsava During Deepawali 4,951/-
Donation for Renovation Work Any Time 100/-
Gaddi Bhent Any Time 100/-
Ghee for Deepak on Closing Day As Per Norms 4,951/-
Ghrit Kambal Ghee on Closing Day As Per Norms 4,951/-
Karpoor Aarti (Bandhan) For 10 years 1,951/-
Kheer Bhog As Per Norms 911/-
Mahabhog (Bandhan) For 10 years 32,50/-1
Mata Murti Utsav On Vaman Dwadasi 4,951/-
Nitya Niyam Bhog As Per Norms 10,551/-
Nitya Niyam Bhog for Deities of Subordinate Temple As Per Norms 6,351/-
Pind Prasad As Per Norms 101/-
Shri Krishna Janmashtami Utsav As Per Norms 10,551/-
Special Donation Any Time 100/-
Srarwani Rudrabhishek In Shravan Month 11,701/-
Swaran Aarti (Bandhan) For 10 years 5,201/-
Vishnu Sahasranamavali (Bandhan) For 10 years 9,101/-
Vishnu Sahasranamam Path (Bandhan) For 10 years 7,411/-
Yatri Bhog As Per Norms 101/-

Puja/Paath/Bhog/Aarti Rate List of Badrinath Temple (presence of pilgrim is required)

Abhishek Puja 4:30 am to 6:30 am 4,100/-
Akhand Jyoti One Day As Per Norms 1,451/-
Astotari Puja Between 6 pm to 9 pm (For 10-15 minutes) 351/-
Chandi Aarti Between 6 pm to 9 pm (For 5-10 minutes) 351/-
Entire Pujas of a Day As Per Norms 11,700/-
Geeta Path 3 pm to 6 pm 2,500/-
Karpoor Aarti Between 6 pm to 9 pm (For 5-10 minutes) 151/-
Maha-Abhishek Puja 4:30 am to 6:30 am 4,300/-
Shayan Aarti with Geet Govind Path End of the Day 3,100/-
Shrimad Bhagwat Saptah Path For One Week 35,101/-
Swaran Aarti Between 6 pm to 9 pm (For 5-10 minutes) 376/-
Ved Path 7:30 am to 12 noon 2,100/-
Vishnu Sahasranama Wali Path Between 6 pm to 9 pm (For 10-15 minutes) 576/-
Vishnu Sahasranamam Path Between 6 pm to 9 pm (For 10-15 minutes) 456/-

 

How to Book an Online Puja Service for Badrinath

The online puja booking process for Badrinath is a very easy process. Devotees can easily follow some steps in order to book a particular Puja / Bhog / Paath or Aarti service. Online payment will be needed to be done on behalf of the pilgrim by the temple authorities as per the given rituals. Here are the steps on how to do it:

  1. Register yourself at the Badri-Kedar Website.
  2. Login to the website.
  3. Select your choice of Pooja / Bhog/ Paath or Aarti service
  4. Fill up your details.
  5. Make the online payment and you’re done.

The prices of these puja services are fair and there are several other types of pujas available at different Chardham temples.

Badrinath Puja Rates Frequently Asked Questions

Who Does The Puja In Badrinath?

All the special pujas are performed by the chief of priests in the presence of the pilgrims and temple officials and helpers.

Who Built The Badrinath Temple?

The temple was constructed by Adi Shankaracharya during the 8th-9th century. He even stayed there for 6 years before spending the rest of his life in Kedarnath.

Which Month Is Best For Badrinath Visit?

The best time to visit Badrinath is from late April to early June.

Is Registration Required For Badrinath?

A Char Dham registration is compulsory for those planning to visit the Char Dham temples as well as the Hemkund Sahib in Uttarakhand.
